Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to understand the requirements for both the normative rules and the desiderata The normative rules are strict so any violation there is a problem The desiderata are more about best practices but not mandatory

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The key constraints are the sequence of activities The correct order is Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant if Approved then Finalize Documentation Close Case Also if rejected no finalizing documentation before closing

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 1 The sequence seems correct Application received then credit check risk assessment loan decision approved inform applicant finalize documentation close case All steps are in order No issues here So Case 1 is compliant with normative rules

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 2 Application received then Risk Assessment is done before Credit Check Thats a violation of the sequence rule because Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Also after the loan decision rejected they did Finalize Documentation which is not allowed if rejected So Case 2 has two normative violations wrong order of Credit Check and Risk Assessment and finalizing documentation after rejection

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 Application received on 2024 01 12 Credit Check on 2024 01 14 which is more than 24 hours later Thats a desideratum violation timing recommendation not a normative one Then the Loan Decision is on 2024 01 14 and Inform Applicant is on 2024 01 16 which is more than 48 hours after the decision Thats another desideratum violation Also theres no Follow up Call which is a desideratum But all normative steps are followed Credit Check before Risk Assessment then Risk Assessment before Loan Decision etc So Case 3 is compliant with normative rules but has desideratum issues

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait the desiderata include timing for Credit Check within 24 hours and informing the applicant within 48 hours of decision For Case 2 the Credit Check was done after Risk Assessment which is a normative issue but the timing of Credit Check Let me check Case 2s Application Received is 2024 01 11 0800 Credit Check is done at 0820 which is within 24 hours Wait no the problem in Case 2 is that the Credit Check was done after Risk Assessment The Credit Check was done on 2024 01 11 0820 but the Risk Assessment was done at 0800 Wait no the event log for Case 2 says So the Credit Check was done after the Risk Assessment So thats a normative violation The timing of Credit Check in Case 2 Application was received at 0800 Credit Check at 0900 Thats within 24 hours so the desideratum is met

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 The Credit Check was done on 2024 01 14 1000 which is 2 days after Application Received on 2024 01 12 Thats more than 24 hours so thats a desideratum violation Then the Inform Applicant is on 2024 01 16 1500 which is 2 days after the Loan Decision 2024 01 14 1200 Thats 48 hours and 3 hours later which is over the recommended 48 hours So thats another desideratum violation Also no Follow up Call So Case 3 has three desideratum issues

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 1 Identify normative violations Case 2 Credit Check after Risk Assessment wrong order and Finalize Documentation after rejection Case 3 No normative violations

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Case 2 None Wait the desiderata include the timing So no desideratum violation in timing But the follow up call is missing Wait the event log for Case 2 doesnt mention a Follow up Call but the desiderata recommend it So even though the normative rules are violated the desideratum of Follow up Call is not met So Case 2s desideratum issues are no follow up call But the event log for Case 2 has no Follow up Call so thats a desideratum violation So both Case 2 and 3 have missing Follow up Calls

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Wait looking back at the event logs For Case 3 it says No Follow up Call So only Case 3 is mentioned as missing the Follow up Call For Case 2 the event log doesnt have a Follow up Call entry So if the event log for Case 2 doesnt have it then thats a desideratum violation However the user might have only noted Case 3 as missing it Maybe the user intended that only Case 3 is missing it but based on the data Case 2 is also missing it This might be a confusion Maybe the user intended that only Case 3 is missing the Follow up Call But based on the data provided I have to go with whats in the table However to be precise based on the given data Case 3 is explicitly noted as missing the Follow up Call while Case 2s event log doesnt have it Ill proceed with that as the note is explicit for Case 3 So for desiderata Case 3 has three issues Case 2 has the missing Follow up Call as a desideratum issue But the users note only mentions Case 3s missing Follow up Call Hmm This is a bit tricky but Ill proceed with the given data
